metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1638 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
(1) debian/postrm and (2) debian/localepurge.config in localepurge before 0.7.3.2 use tempfile to create a safe temporary file but appends a suffix to the original filename and writes to this new filename, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the new filename.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

localepurge - 0.7.3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: localepurge package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.3.2').
